svg.text: Mimic Ink Recipes for PV Fabrication Testing
Xanthan Gum-Based Formulations Â· 10 mL Batch Size Â· Viscosity-Matched to Real Solar Cell Inks
These mimic inks allow testing of dispensing parameters, line width, registration, and drying behavior
without using expensive or hazardous real materials. Viscosities are matched to actual solar cell inks.
â€º 0.002â€“0.003 g xanthan gum + 1 drop dish soap + 0.3 mL glycerin
â€º 9 mL deionized water + 1â€“2 drops yellow + 1 drop red food coloring
â€º 9.4 mL deionized water + 0.6 mL glycerin
â€º 0.2 mL clear hand sanitizer gel + 1 drop dish soap
No water-based mimic needed â€” Ni pen matches rheology for prototype testing
â€º 9.5 mL deionized water + 0.5 mL glycerin
â€º 7 mL PVA school glue + 3 mL deionized water
â€º Add xanthan gum slowly while stirring vigorously
â€º Rest 5â€“10 min after mixing to allow full hydration
â€º Stir again immediately before dispensing
â€º Store sealed, refrigerated â€” good for 1â€“2 weeks
â€º Bring to room temperature before use
â€º Hand sanitizer gel (Step 4) helps achieve proper
â€º Mimic inks do NOT function as solar cell materials
â€º Use to optimize: line width, registration accuracy,
â€º Switch to real materials in Nâ‚‚ glovebox once
â€º Xanthan amounts are critical â€” start low,
â€º All real-material steps in Nâ‚‚ glovebox (<1 ppm Oâ‚‚)
â€º Suitable for unlimited nozzle calibration runs
â€º Saves hundreds before committing real materials
